intro: Mariscus schoenodes, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mariscus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, finely divided leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in dry, grassy habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
